definition: father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
second month of a season/middle/intermediate/second amongst brothers
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
